intro: Lasiacis grisebachii var. grisebachii, commonly known as the Grisebach's lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its grayish-green thallus with a finely granular texture and distinct, elongated lobes. The plant typically grows on bark, stone, or soil in temperate to subtropical regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites, contributing to its ecological role as a bioindicator species. It is often found in shaded, moist environments, thriving in areas with moderate humidity and indirect light.
